rules.name: High Fever Duration Rule
rules.recommendation: Persistent fever for more than 5 days requires immediate medical evaluation to rule out serious infections like Typhoid, Dengue, or bacterial infections.

rules.name: Dengue Warning Signs
rules.condition: dengue_likely AND (platelet_low OR bleeding OR severe_abdominal_pain)
rules.recommendation: Warning signs suggest possible severe dengue (hemorrhagic fever). Immediate hospitalization recommended.

rules.name: Respiratory Distress
rules.recommendation: Respiratory symptoms with difficulty breathing require chest examination. Consider pneumonia, COVID-19, or other respiratory infections.

rules.name: Dehydration Assessment
rules.condition: vomiting AND diarrhea AND (dry_mouth OR reduced_urination)
rules.recommendation: Signs of dehydration present. ORS and IV fluids may be required. Monitor for worsening.

rules.name: Chest Pain Evaluation
rules.condition: chest_pain AND (age > 40 OR sweating OR shortness_of_breath)
rules.recommendation: Chest pain with risk factors requires immediate cardiac evaluation. Do not delay medical care.

rules.name: Neurological Symptoms
rules.condition: confusion OR sudden_weakness OR speech_difficulty OR vision_changes
rules.recommendation: Neurological symptoms may indicate stroke or serious brain condition. Time-critical emergency.

rules.name: Pediatric Fever
rules.recommendation: Fever in infants under 3 months requires immediate medical evaluation.

rules.name: Drug Interaction Check
rules.recommendation: Bleeding symptoms in patients on anticoagulants require immediate INR check and medical review.

rules.name: Diabetic Emergency
rules.condition: diabetic AND (confusion OR fruity_breath OR rapid_breathing)
rules.recommendation: Possible diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA). Requires immediate emergency care and IV insulin.

rules.name: Allergic Reaction
rules.condition: rash AND (swelling OR breathing_difficulty) AND recent_medication
rules.recommendation: Possible severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis). Administer epinephrine if available and call emergency services.

rules.name: Malaria High Risk
rules.recommendation: High suspicion for malaria. Peripheral smear and rapid diagnostic test recommended. Start antimalarials if confirmed.

rules.name: COVID-19 Severity
rules.recommendation: Moderate to severe COVID-19. Hospital admission recommended for oxygen support and monitoring.

rules.name: Appendicitis Suspicion
rules.recommendation: Clinical presentation suggests possible appendicitis. Surgical consultation recommended.

rules.name: UTI Complication
rules.recommendation: UTI with systemic symptoms may indicate pyelonephritis. Requires antibiotics and possible hospitalization.

rules.name: Pregnancy Warning
rules.condition: pregnant AND (vaginal_bleeding OR severe_abdominal_pain OR headache)
rules.recommendation: Warning symptoms during pregnancy require immediate obstetric evaluation.

ors.child: 50-100ml after each loose stool (under 2 years: 50-100ml, 2-10 years: 100-200ml)

urgent.description: Serious condition requiring prompt medical attention

escalate.description: Condition requiring medical evaluation but not immediately life-threatening

routine.description: Non-urgent condition suitable for routine consultation
